fields.description:
1) On the *Create a New Job* page (e.g. {{http://<servername>:<port>/chain/admin/newJob.action?buildKey=PROJKEY-PLANKEY&existingStage=Default+Stage}}), please update the following text:
* *Job Details* section -> *Stage* field description should be:
** "Select a Stage to which this Job will be added."
* *Enable this plan* section should be:
** "Enable this Job"
** Also change description of the *Yes Please!* check box to:
*** "By selecting this option, your Job will be available for building.
Do not select this option if you have advanced configuration changes to make after creation."
** Please do the same for {{cloneJob.action}} although I suspect this will be done automatically.

2) Please add a line space between the two introductory paragraphs on the following page to make it easier to read:
* {{http://<servername>:<port>/admin/viewConcurrentBuildConfig.action}}

3) Wording on the *Agents* page which shows an agent's details, needs amendment. The term *Executable Plans* should be *Executable Jobs* (see attached *agent-page-problem* screenshot). It's misleading to refer to these as *Executable Plans* because in Bamboo 2.7:
* It's Jobs that execute on agents - not Plans.
* Multiple Jobs in a given Plan could be executed on several different agents.

4) The *Agents and Plans Matrix* should be entitled *Agents and Jobs Matrix*. This matrix lists Jobs against Agents (see attached *agents-and-plans-matrix* screenshot) and again, the focus of this page is on Jobs - not Plans.
fields.summary: Text/wording issues that need addressing on the Bamboo 2.7 UI.

fields.description:
I have a flex project under maven with flex-mojos. maven version 2.2.1, flex-mojos version: 3.8

When I run "mvn clean package" from command line - everything is fine. When I try to run it from bamboo I get error:

Software caused connection abort: socket write errorD:\bamboo-home271\xml-data\build-dir\LIBS-TRUNK-JOB1\target\test-classes\TestRunner.swf

I think it is because maven under bamboo cannot properly run flashplayer. In previous version of bamboo 2.6.X I had no such a problem.

Please find attached full log file.
fields.summary: Build fails in Bamboo even it runs in console

fields.description:
Jason has created a {{[@ui.messageBox]}} component that we can now use instead of the {{
}} code we currently have everywhere! It's in and ready to use, so wherever you happen to notice one of the old style of message boxes please drop in the new one. {quote} *Usage* It takes a number of parameters and I've set some intelligent defaults, but the one you really want to make sure you set is the "type", which should be one of the following: * info * warning * error * success There are a couple more available (that you can see on the [AUI Message demo|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/~raw,r=trunk/AJS/trunk/auiplugin/src/demo/messages/messages-demo.html], notably "generic" and "hint") but I'd recommend against using those just yet as they haven't been looked over by the style guide team as yet. If you find any problems with it please let me know so that I can roll those changes back into AUI (or make some custom overrides for Bamboo if it's necessary). {quote}
fields.summary: Switch old message boxes to AUI ui.messageBoxes

fields.description:
We are using a single agent elastic bamboo instance with Auto-mount EBS volume everytime option. But, as opposed to the description, it doesn't mounts the EBS volume (the one mounted last time) and creates a fresh EBS from the snapshot.

This makes sense for those using many agents configuration, but, for several developers with a single agent license, the same EBS volume must be used instead on creating a fresh one every time.

I mean that there should be an option for this at least. Currently, I assume the process is as follows:

1) Create a EBS volume from the snapshot (snapshotId is provided in configuration) and get its volumeId.
2) Mount the volumeId to the new instance.

I propose that it should be modified as:
1) Ask for a snapshotId and a EBS volumeId(s) in elastic bamboo instance configuration and keep those in record.
2) Launch a new instance and check if a volumeId provided is valid and not mounted already, and if its free, mount it to the new instance and if none of the volumeId(s) is valid and free, create a new volume from the snapshotId, get newly created volumeId and mount it.
3) Optional: Update the newly created volumeId in record (array) for reuse.

I think the option to reuse the existing EBS volume (the same which was used last time) may be provided easily in the elastic bamboo, at least for those using a single instance and this will be of great help for many customers.

This issue is same as https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-3293 and the one that is irrelevant may be closed.

Thanks & Regards
fields.summary: Capability to reuse the existing EBS volume by elastic bamboo instead on creating a fresh volume everytime from the snapshot

fields.description:
If you have a large project with many plans, it's difficult to set up the same set of plans on a new branch when starting a new piece of work.

If there was a way to bulk edit or manage configuration in Bamboo, you could manage it there. However, I think an easier solution to implement is a set of new REST APIs which support viewing and editing plan and job configuration.

This would allow customers like us at Atlassian to write scripts to maintain our Bamboo plans remotely, and create a set of new plans from existing configurations very easily.
fields.summary: REST API for viewing and updating plan/job configuration

Create > X plans
Switch to a < X plan license

fields.summary: Need links to test tabs of jobs from plan summary

fields.description:
Several times browsing on BEAC, I see the Actions menu open before the page finishes loading. It looks like the menu is visible by default, then hidden onDOMReady with some JavaScript.

This could be a bit confusing for users who are trying to click it, because the menu is visible but doesn't function yet.

(I wasn't going to bother raising this, but Jason said, "I don't like seeing ugly stuff before domready gets fired, so I ... would like to fix \[it]".)
fields.summary: Actions menu appears on plan screen before page is loaded

fields.description:
jobs should be listed under their parent (which happens) but the next plan actually looks like its a job of the previous plan.  See screen shot.
http://skitch.com/brydiemccoy/d9qib/confirm-plans-to-be-deleted-atlassian-bambooooo
fields.summary: Job/Plan layout problem when confirming plan deletion
Web repository isn't validating when configuring Plan.

fields.description: The current build-queued icon is not anti-aliased very well. It looks really weird on a blue background -- see the screenshot.
fields.summary: Improve appearance of "build queued" icon on non-white backgrounds

fields.description: You have the builder in brackets with one font/size, and then "disabled" in brackets next to that in another font/size
fields.summary: View plan configuration -> stages list looks strange when jobs are disabled

fields.description:
It seems that if the Jira project key has a "." in it, Bamboo only processes what comes after "." as the real issue key.
You can see this in the attached screenshot where the issue key is "CETELEM.FIDEL-41" but bamboo creates the link to "FIDEL-41". This happens in all Bamboo not only this screen.
fields.summary: Jira issue keys with "." are truncated

fields.description:
Why do we have to restart the remote agents, when the bamboo server is restartet?

Whould'nt be better that the remoteagends do a reconnect automaticly?

Kind regards Thomas
fields.summary: remote build agents

fields.description:
The following documentation is not updated :
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Viewing+a+Test%27s+History

Part of the information in the Test's History page is no more presented (eg: the graph presentation) in the bamboo version 2.6 documentation
fields.summary: Update documentation for Bamboo Test's History page

fields.description:
In Bamboo version 2.2 there is graph presented in the Test's History page as stated in the following documentation:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Viewing+a+Test%27s+History

However, in Bamboo version 2.6.3 the detail is lost. It would be good if the feature is brought back.
fields.summary: Providing additional information in Test's History page

fields.description:
Currently the job has a logs tab, which shows very little (I think it just logs when jobs complete.)
There is nothing like this at the plan level.

I think: we should get rid of the tab all together on the job level and actually have one on the chain level.  We also need to make sure job errors are logged to the proper error logs so they show up on the summary pages, rather than just on the plan logs. We should also make sure we have decent stuff going into the chain's log, ie change detection and build triggering info..
fields.summary: Fix plan logs

fields.description:
In Bamboo 2.6, the hover was indicated with a grey background. This no longer works in Bamboo 2.7-rc2. See the attached screenshot.

Notice also in the screenshot that you have tooltips on the menu item links. I think this probably isn't necessary and causes usability problems when the tooltips cover up the other menu options like in this screenshot. In almost all cases, the tooltips just duplicate the link title. (We do the same in Confluence, and should probably ditch them too.)
fields.summary: Actions menu doesn't highlight when hovering any more
Document the use of the PostChainIndexWriter

fields.description:
* Description text needs to sit under field and be greyed/shrunk
* Error messages need to be red
* Alignment in general could do with fixing

This may be due to lost styles, or perhaps a version mismatch between oauth and AUI.
fields.summary: Styles for auth pages cause confusion

fields.description:
Due to the bulk update changes on the agent configuration page I actually find it much easier/more intuitive to use the popup on the dashboard. However, the popup is to fiddly to make show up as it only works on hover, and clicking takes to to the config page.

My Suggestion: make the popup pop-up on click as well and have a link inside the popup to take you to the config page.

FYI.  one of the reasons I dislike the bulk action, as if the is only one agent in the list, I often just click "disable" without remembering to check the checkbox first.
fields.summary: Agent dashboard popup usability improvement.

fields.description:
On the configureAgents page. http://localhost:8085/admin/agent/configureAgents!default.action
I clicked the disable button without selecting a checkbox but it came up with the red banner at the top of the page saying nothing was selected.  But the actual list of agents has disappeared, so I can't actually rectify the situation.

Before: http://skitch.com/brydiemccoy/d6xjf/agents-atlassian-bamboo
After: http://skitch.com/brydiemccoy/d6xjn/agents-atlassian-bamboo
fields.summary: Agent list disappears on agent manipulation error

fields.description:
Creating new plan (enabled) triggers initial build. Mercurial plugin will instantly trigger another build (if configured to poll repository for the changes) - because it thinks last revision was 'null'.

How to reproduce:
1) just create a plan using valid Mercurial repository, enable it (during creation), set 'poll repository for changes' for example to 10s
2) wait till first build (initial) finishes
3a) instantly second build will be triggered (showing all the changesets from the repository root)
3b) where I expected the build won't be triggered until new commits will be pushed to that repository
fields.summary: Mercurial is instantly triggering another build right after the initial build.

fields.description:
I am using this cmd line to download latest build artifact from Bamboo 

wget --http-user='denist@bzgint.com' --http-password=****** 'https://beezag.jira.com/builds/rest/api/latest/plan?os_authType=basic'

following instructions here http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+the+Bamboo+REST+APIs
fields.summary: Could not download Bamboo artifact with wget

fields.description:
[BAM-7027 Tony Much comment:|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-7027?focusedCommentId=213147&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-213147]

Here is some more feedback, this time based on experience running 2.7 beta2 on Windows XP:

Tried simple Maven 2 Builder with Goal : "-B release:prepare". 
The problem remains the same. Result shows nested ""-s and commit fails with errorcode 1. See previous posts for log example.
I added also : "Verbose logs: true " for Mercurial repository configuration. I see in configuration that : "This Job will use all Repository settings from the plan".
Unfortunately, I cannot see any extra verbosity nor debug info. Can I somehow turn on additional debugging? How?
I also tried separately, giving several release specific parameters (version etc.) as arguments, result is the same.

If my config seems enough/OK then I think this is a real {color:red}blocker issue{color}.

By the way, if Maven plugin ("release:prepare" for example) expects some command line input from user then Bamboo Agent keeps on waiting for that input and cannot be killed / shut down / disabled without Bamboo server restart. This can be tested if you add Maven builder goal "release:prepare" and run it.

good luck
fields.summary: Mercurial doesn't work with maven goal "-B release:prepare"

fields.description:
When selecting a single project from the dashboard such as a link like this:

https://www.myhostname.com/bamboo/browse/TRUNK

The left side has a large blank column under the project name.  It would be better to put the project name above all the build plans instead of to the left of the first build plan.  This would allow each build plan to span the entire window width.

fields.description:
The BuildCompletedEventListener only runs CustomBuildCompletActions against Build objects.  So plugins will never run against jobs.  Strangely there is todo in the class that says it should run for top level plans.

We need to
a) confirm what it should be running and ensure I am not dreaming that it doesn't work
b) Fix it and put in on 2.7 final

This issue is going to effect plugins, and prevents the auto build labeller from working at all.

fields.description:
When I click on Project summary page (like the one under link similar to: http://localhost:8085/bamboo/browse/ZZ ) I've got nasty freemarker exceptions instead of comments.

The project has to have at least two plans, I reckon both must have been started and filled with build results.

Exact message:
{code}
Expression action.planResultHasComments is undefined on line 581, column 10 in lib/components.ftl.
The problematic instruction:
----------
==> if action.planResultHasComments(buildResultsSummary) [on line 581, column 5 in lib/components.ftl]
 in user-directive cp.commentIndicator [on line 282, column 13 in fragments/plan/displayWideBuildPlansList.ftl]
 in user-directive planList.displayWideBuildPlansList [on line 12, column 1 in project/viewProject.ftl]
----------

Java backtrace for programmers:
----------
freemarker.core.InvalidReferenceException: Expression action.planResultHasComments is undefined on line 581, column 10 in lib/components.ftl.
	at freemarker.core.TemplateObject.assertNonNull(TemplateObject.java:124)
	at freemarker.core.TemplateObject.invalidTypeException(TemplateObject.java:134)
{code}
etc etc...

I think the problem was introduced with the following changeset:
{code}

fields.description: When one is setting up the Artifact specifications for a build, one can only add or delete. If one makes a mistake, say in a directory specification, one can not go and edit it. But instead one needs to delete the incorrect one and then add a new one. Not a friendly workflow.
fields.summary: Allow editing of Artifact specifications

fields.description:
It's a pitty that Bamboo has little capabilities to make tagged builds in Subversion.
With a global property we change the source URL in a Plan, so we can make a tagged build.
Bamboo detects that the path has changed:
Existing source path at 'D:\bamboo-home\xml-data\XXX' is 'http://XXX/tags/XXX' and differs from 'http://XXX/branches/release_517r'
This is great! Now Bamboo deletes the files and does a new checkout. In our case this has taken 4 hours. (Because it is a big project and because the build server was heavily used)
But this would be a lot faster if Bamboo could use SVN switch in stead of the clean checkout. SVN switch would take as long as a normal SVN update. (With SVN switch you can switch the sources from one branch to another) in stead of new checkout.
So my question is: can we somehow use SVN switch?
fields.summary: Can Bamboo use SVN switch in stead of new checkout when the source path has changed?

fields.description: Removing remote agent does not remove them from the list immediately. I need to refresh it to make agent disappear.
fields.summary: Removing remote agent does not remove them from the list immediately

fields.description:
Hi all,

It would be nice if I would have the possibility to add a Maven 3.x (or Maven 3.0) Builder.
When I want to build with Maven 3 I have to choose Maven 2.x or Maven Builder.
That's not nice ;(

Regards,
Florian
fields.summary: Maven 3.0 or 3.x Builder

fields.description:
Often on tardigrade you see all the jobs have "No agent can run this job." because our builds only build on ec2, and the agents are spawned on demand. It would be great if it was a bit smarter. e.g. "This build can be built on ec2 but not agents are currently online." and a non-ec2 case: "This build can be built on 2 agents but they currently disabled"
e.g. http://skitch.com/brydiemccoy/d7f1f/the-project-of-doom-the-awesome-chain-edit-plan-configuration-atlassian-bambooooo
fields.summary: "No agent can build this" message for job does not take into account ec2 image capabilities

fields.description:
It seems that merge changesets that do not change any files are not counted.
This may happen when the merge is trivial (new files only)
fields.summary: Changeset collection skips the change that triggered the build

fields.description:
The Hg docs provide examples with 2 file notations:
{code}
local/filesystem/path[#revision]
AND
file://local/filesystem/path[#revision]
{code}
Only the first works.

If the second is used, the attached error is reported.
fields.summary: File notation is not working for the Hg Repository URL

fields.description:
On the source repository configuration page, when configuring excludes/includes, there is a link to regular expressions.  Believe it or not, some people responsible for configuring plans don't know what regular expressions are:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Specifying+a+Plan%27s+Source+Repository?focusedCommentId=223221360#comment-223221360

They aren't helped by the fact that the link is to:

http://www.regular-expressions.info/java.html

Which says nothing about regular expression syntax, but rather is all about how to use the Java regular expression classes, which is not what users are trying to do here, they need a link to regular expression syntax.
fields.summary: Link to regular expression help is not helpful
Relative date shown by bamboo "one week ago" is not accurate

fields.description:
Currently Bamboo supports Script builds in SH and BASH

However it does not allow scripts from *ksh*, *csh*, *tcsh*, *zsh* to be run directly by an Agent.

A workaround would be to wrap the non-supported script in a supported script.

*Example*
wrap.sh would contain: {{/bin/ksh build.sh}}
fields.summary: Allow Bamboo to run builds in more shells

fields.description:
Emails sent by jira are mime/multipart-alternative.  This means they contain multiple versions of the email as appropriate for different software or human consumers.

As is common, the two versions are text/html and text/plain.

The html version is typically used more commonly by more recently designed email clients, which incorporate (for better or worse) entire html rendering engines into their email display.  These emails look pretty reasonable when loaded into an html rendering program.

The plaintext version is used by software which does not incorporate html rendering, such as automated tools, text based mailers, or mailers configured to avoid the security issues of html rendering.

Unfortunately the plaintext version of the emails is not really plain text.  It's essentially marked up text that the user is expected to read past manually.  Here is an example of such an alert generated within atlassian's own bamboo install.

Note that the urls, brackets of various sorts, and so on are from the original text, not added by any email client or other software.

Further note that these urls are not asides, after the relevant text, but inserted in the middle of statements, between subject and lists, which makes the text nearly impossible to read.

Ideally all of the text within the brackets should not be produced, or should be produced entirely aside from the main email text.

The upshot, for me at least, is that all the bamboo reports here are useless, and I have to simply configure my mail routing to automatically delete them.
